revised_title: Observations of the Second Comet of 1822 in Rio de Janeiro
tldr: In 1822, Captain William Robertson and Lieutenant Charles Drinkwater observed the second comet of the year from Rio de Janeiro. They determined its position by measuring angular distances from known fixed stars using a reflecting sextant. Their observations, along with those made in Europe, helped in calculating the comet's orbit and understanding its position in the solar system.
